name: cute cuffed newborn & baby pants
notes:
❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️

**special offer alert! 
add this pattern to your cart to unlock the exclusive discounted price—don't miss this sale!**

❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️

get ready to “awww” over these crochet baby pants that miraculously look like they’re knitted! not only are they adorable, but they’re also super easy to make - crocheted flat and then joined. trust us, the fabric is as squishy and cozy as it sounds.

plus, with 5 sizes ranging from newborn to 3 years old, you can deck out all the little ones in
your life. don’t let this pattern slip away - your baby’s wardrobe, or that next baby shower, is the perfect use!

the knit look fabric is achieved by working simple stitches, single crochet and half double crochet, in the back loop only.

these baby pants come with a video tutorial.
https://youtu.be/2n2whswpc3u

**crochet hook:**
[recommended hook size g (4.0mm)][2] - or size to meet gauge

**notations:**
[removable stitch marker][3]
[yarn needle to weave in ends][4]
[scissors][5]

**yarn:**
[lion brand color theory][6]
100% acrylic, 246yds/100g

**yardage:**
260 (325, 400, 515, 640) yds; 2 (2, 2, 3, 3) skeins

**abbreviations**
blo - back loop only
ch - chain
hdc - half double crochet
na - not applicable
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)

**gauge:**
19 sts x 14 rows unblocked= 4x4” in alpine st.

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post: [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][7]

**sizes:**
newborn (3 months, 6-9 months, 12-18
months, 2-3 years)

**skill level:**
advanced beginner
